title: CLIEMiT (Correlative Light Electron and Ion Microscopy in Tissue)
content: Correlative light, electron, and ion microscopy (CLEIM) [1] has significant potential for tracking the intracellular destiny of antibiotics at the organelle level. However, a correlative approach enabling the visualization of subcellular antibiotic distribution in pathogen-infected tissue is currently lacking. Here we give an overview of correlative light, electron, and ion microscopy in tissue (CLEIMiT) [2] and its applications to discern the cell typeâ€“specific accumulation of an antibiotic in lung lesions of mice infected with Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
